info.name: E-Commerce API Documentation
info.description: Comprehensive API for managing products, orders, payments, users, vendors, and more in an e-commerce platform.

request.description:
Creates a new user account with email verification. The user will receive an email to verify their account.
Passwords must meet security requirements including minimum length, character diversity, and cannot be common passwords.
Authenticates a user and returns an access token. Implements account lockout protection and tracks failed attempts.

response.body:
{
  "message": "Account is temporarily locked due to multiple failed login attempts.",
  "locked_until": "2024-01-15T15:30:00.000000Z",
  "time_remaining_seconds": 1800,
  "time_remaining_minutes": 30,
  "lockout_count": 2
}

request.description: Logs out the authenticated user and revokes their access token.
Changes the authenticated user's password. Requires current password verification and validates new password strength.
Retrieves comprehensive security information for the authenticated user including account lock status, security score, and password expiry details.
Sends a password reset link to the user's email address.
Resets the user's password using a valid reset token from the forgot password email.

query.description: The expiration timestamp for the verification link. Automatically included.
The signature that validates the signed URL. Automatically included.

variable.description: The verification hash that ensures the link is valid and hasn't been tampered with. This is automatically included in the verification link.
The ID of the user whose email is being verified. This is automatically included in the verification link.

request.description:
This endpoint verifies a user's email address using a signed URL that is sent to their email
after registration. The verification link contains the user ID and a hash for security.
Once verified, the user's email_verified_at timestamp is set and they can access protected features.

response.name: Email verified successfully
Email already verified
Invalid or expired verification link
Signature verification failed

response.name: User not found

request.description:
Sends a new email verification link to the authenticated user's email address.
This is useful when users don't receive the initial verification email or when
the verification link has expired. The user must be authenticated to request a resend.

response.name: Verification email sent successfully
Email already verified
User not authenticated
Too many requests
Email sending failed

query.description: optional Filter orders by specific user ID.
optional Filter orders by specific status ID.
optional Page number for pagination. Default: 1.
optional Number of orders per page (max 50). Default: 15.

request.description:
Get a paginated list of all orders in the system. This endpoint supports filtering by user and status,
and includes comprehensive order information including items, user details, and current status.

response.name: Success with orders
No orders found
Insufficient permissions
Invalid filter parameters

request.description:
Create a new order with multiple order items. The system will automatically calculate the total amount
based on the items and their quantities. All monetary values should be provided in pennies.

response.name: Order created successfully
Insufficient permissions
User not found
Validation errors
Server error

variable.description: The ID of the order to retrieve.

request.description:
Get detailed information about a specific order including all order items, user details,
payment information, and any associated returns or refunds.

response.name: Order found
Insufficient permissions
Order not found

variable.description: The ID of the order to update.

request.description:
Update an existing order including its items. This will replace all existing order items with the new ones
and recalculate the total amount. Use with caution as this will affect order history.

response.name: Order updated successfully
Order cannot be updated
Insufficient permissions
Order not found
Validation errors

variable.description: The ID of the order to soft delete.

request.description:
Soft delete an order, making it inactive but preserving the data for audit purposes.
The order will be hidden from normal queries but can be restored if needed.

response.name: Order soft deleted successfully
Order cannot be deleted
Insufficient permissions
Order not found

variable.description: The ID of the soft deleted order to permanently delete.

request.description:
Permanently remove an order from the database. This action is irreversible and should be used
with extreme caution. The order must be soft deleted first before it can be permanently deleted.

response.name: Order permanently deleted
Order must be soft deleted first
Insufficient permissions
Order not found
Order has dependencies

variable.description: The ID of the soft deleted order to restore.

request.description:
Restore a previously soft deleted order, making it active again in the system.
Only orders that have been soft deleted can be restored.

response.name: Order restored successfully
Order not deleted
Insufficient permissions
Order not found

query.description: optional Filter orders by specific user ID.
optional Filter orders by specific status ID.
optional Page number for pagination. Default: 1.
optional Number of orders per page (max 50). Default: 15.

request.description:
Get a paginated list of all orders in the system. This endpoint supports filtering by user and status,
and includes comprehensive order information including items, user details, and current status.

response.name: Success with orders
No orders found
Insufficient permissions
Invalid filter parameters

variable.description: The ID of the order to retrieve.

request.description:
Get detailed information about a specific order including all order items, user details,
payment information, and any associated returns or refunds.

response.name: Order found
Insufficient permissions
Order not found

variable.description: The payment gateway to use. Currently only "stripe" is supported.

request.description:
Creates a new Stripe PaymentIntent for the specified order, or returns an existing one if already created.
This prevents duplicate payment intents for the same order. The client secret returned should be used
on the frontend to complete the payment with Stripe's client-side libraries.

response.name: New PaymentIntent created
Existing PaymentIntent retrieved
Order already paid
Unsupported gateway
Order not eligible for payment
Order not found
Invalid order data
Stripe API error

variable.description: The payment gateway used. Currently only "stripe" is supported.

request.description:
Manually verifies the status of a payment with Stripe and updates the local database accordingly.
This is useful for handling cases where webhooks might have failed or been delayed.
It fetches the latest payment status directly from Stripe and synchronizes it with your database.

response.name: Payment verified as successful
Payment still pending
Payment failed
Unsupported gateway
Payment amount mismatch
Payment not found in database
Validation errors
Stripe API error

request.description:
This endpoint receives webhook events from Stripe when payment-related events occur.
It automatically processes payment status updates, handles refunds, and manages order status changes.
This endpoint is called directly by Stripe's servers and requires proper webhook signature verification.

**Important**: This endpoint should be excluded from CSRF protection and rate limiting.

response.name: Webhook processed successfully
Payment success webhook
Refund webhook processed
Invalid Stripe signature
Invalid payload format
Webhook processing error

item.name: Retrieve a paginated list of products.

formdata.description: Must not be greater than 255 characters.

formdata.value: Eius et animi quos velit et.

formdata.description: The id of an existing record in the product_categories table.
The id of an existing record in the product_statuses table.
Must not be greater than 255 characters.

formdata.value: Eius et animi quos velit et.

formdata.description: The id of an existing record in the product_categories table.
The id of an existing record in the product_statuses table.

item.name: Retrieve a paginated list of products.
Retrieve a paginated list of all refund records.
Process a refund for an approved return through the specified payment gateway.

variable.description: The payment gateway to process the refund through. Currently supports: stripe.
The ID of the return request to refund.

item.name: Retrieve a paginated list of all return requests.
Review and update the status of a return request.

variable.description: The ID of the return request.
The action to perform on the return. Must be one of: review, approve, reject.

item.name: Create a new return request for an order item.

body.raw: {"order_item_id":25,"reason":"The product arrived damaged and doesn't match the description."}

item.name: Retrieve all permissions for a role.
Assign specific permissions to a role.
Assign all available permissions to a role.
Revoke a specific permission from a role.

variable.description: The ID of the permission to revoke.

Retrieve a paginated list of vendors.

formdata.value: Et animi quos velit et fugiat.
formdata.description: Must not be greater than 1000 characters.
